summary: This document is an email correspondence involving Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley, discussing an out-of-office auto-reply from Jes Staley's office. The email indicates that Staley is out of the country and provides alternative contact information for Sharon Gislinghain. The communication is marked as confidential and may contain privileged information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email and is communicating with Jes Staley regarding his out-of-office status.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email and is noted to be out of the country during the specified dates.

persons.name: Sharon Gislinghain
persons.context: Gislinghain is mentioned as the alternative contact for Jes Staley while he is out of the country.

persons.name: The Duke
persons.context: The Duke's auto-reply is forwarded in the email, indicating he is also out of the country.

connections.description: Epstein is communicating with Staley regarding his absence and providing alternative contact information.
Gislinghain is noted as a staff member in Staley's office, responsible for handling messages in his absence.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein sent an email to Jes Staley regarding Staley's out-of-office status.
Jes Staley is out of the country from September 1 to September 12, 2010.
Sharon Gislinghain is mentioned as the point of contact during Staley's absence.
The communication is marked as confidential and may contain privileged information.
The Duke's auto-reply indicates he is also out of the country.
